description.narrative: Strengthening targeted national capacities to improve decision-making and mainstreaming global environmental obligations into national development priorities

activity-description.narrative: Decision on exact municipality will be made by the end of this year

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1. # of new partnership mechanisms with funding for sustainable management solutions of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or subnational level 2. # of countries with legal, policy and institutional frameworks in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems 3. # of direct project beneficiaries 4. Systems for data and information are strengthened and Rio Convention obligations are mainstreamed into sectoral plans that include targets to measure progress toward achieving global environmental obligations 5. A data and information management system is developed and tested that allows data, information, and knowledge to be tracked through creation to informing policy and plans 6. Stakeholders are trained on best practice skills to use data and information for planning and decision-making on the global environment 7. A long-term training programme is developed and institutionalized on Rio Convention mainstreaming based on lessons learned from the project’s learning-by-doing workshops and related exercises 8. Inter-ministerial and inter-directorate communication, coordination, and collaboration is strengthened 9. Non-state public consultative mechanisms developed and integrated into official planning and decision-making processes 10. Operational by-laws are developed to improve and legitimize Rio Convention mainstreaming into sector development plans. 11. New and improved best practice approaches to reconcile sectoral priorities with Rio Convention obligations are integrated into the decision-making framework 12. A sustainable financing strategy is developed for the national environmental information system 13. Raised awareness of the contribution of global environmental values to socio-economic development 14. Education modules on the importance of the global environment developed and English language courses held 15. Collectively and over the

comment.narrative:
1. 0 2. The baseline of this indicator is qualitatively measured as inadequate, reflected by the inadequacy of existing policy and legal instruments to guarantee the realization of Rio Convention obligations. 3. 0 4. - Strategies, policies and programmes for environmental conservation are inadequate. - The existing institutional structures and mechanisms for data and information management are out of date and hinder by limited data sharing. 5. Data creation and management remains a major challenge for Timor-Leste. 6. Systems for data and information management are outdated and inadequate. 7. Decision-makers and government staff have limited technical skills
8. There is limited inter and intra agency coordination 9. There is a weak legislative base for coordination and information sharing of research activities 10. Strategies, policies and programmes for environmental conservation are inadequate 11. There is limited availability of funding 12. Existing government and private sector budgets for environmental management are very limited 13. There have been notable observations by stakeholders that low level of awareness among policy makers is a key challenge to promote all environmental issues in TL – particularly for finalizing national policies, plans, strategies and also for allocation of resources in relevant ministries and agencies. 14. Government stakeholders and the general public remain unaware or unconcerned about the contribution of the Rio Conventions to meeting and satisfying local and national socio-economic priorities 15. Awareness of Rio Convention mainstreaming is limited, and stakeholders do not fully appreciating the value of conserving the global environment. 16. During PPG consultations, limited English skills were identified as a major limitation to meeting obligations under the Rio Conventions.

1) A participatory gender analysis conducted and gender mainstreamed in project components. 2) Rio Conventions curriculum for GoTL officials designed. 3) At least 20 master trainers of INAP trained on the new curriculum. 4) At least 25 GoTL officials trained on language proficiency. 5) Baseline prepared for an integrated environmental database management system. 6) At least 20 national journalists trained on environmental reporting. 7) Targeted villages in 2 municipalities supported with implementation of Tara Bandu. 8) Public Service Announcements (PSAs) on Rio Conventions designed. 9) “Green School” and Dissemination of Environmental Law to Sucos (villages) in 4 municipalities - Covalima, Viqueque, Manufahi and Bobonaro.

1) Participatory Gender analysis conducted and mainstreamed into project components through an IC contract 2) Draft Environmental Curriculum designed and consulted with key stakeholders through validation workshop and consultation meetings 3) Due to time constraints, Training for Master Trainers or ToT will be carried out in 2020 4) 25 technical staff from various key ministries participated in a 6 (six) months English Course including; 1) Ministry of Agriculture & Fisheries; 2) Secretary of State for Environment; 3) Ministry of Commerce, Trade, Industry and Turism; 4) Ministry of State Administration; 5) Ministry of Public Works 5) Baseline preparation for Data Base management system is in the progress, will be completed by February 2020 6)Environmental Journalism training for 20 national journalists from Print, Electronic and On line media done within 5 days in October 7) Tara bandu and environment campaign done in Sucos Vatubou, Maubara and Suco Metamali Liquica 8) PSA on Rio Conventions in the form of Pamphlets, Billoards, etc designed, PSA for Radio & TV will be designed in 2020 9) Green School & Dissemination of Environmental Law done in Technical/Vocational School of Akadiruhun Same-Manufahi. Green School activity for Viqueque, Covalima & Bobonaro has been re-scheduled for January 2020 due to school holiday.

1) Feasibility study on an improved electronic platform for information-sharing conducted 2) Undertake stakeholder meetings to agree on institutional reforms 3) Training plans are approved, trainings are launched 4) Support Climate Change Working Group meetings, workshops, and conferences 5) Review/Study of legal framework limiting Rio Conventions is conducted 6) Learn-by-doing workshops to reconcile policy and legal weaknesses and gaps is conducted 7) Appropriate by-laws and operational guidance to mainstream Rio Conventions are formulated/drafted 8) Workshops or meetings on environmental awareness raising conducted (LoA with SSE) 9) 2000 brochures on Rio Conventions are printed and distributed 10) 2 articles on Rio Conventions & Environmental Published 11) Initial survey to be conducted during awareness raising activities 12) 7 Modules on environment curricula for civil servants are completed 13) Rio conventions and CCCD’s project related activities published on social media 14) 2 sets of English training courses (Basic & Level 2) held

1) Feasibility study has been postponed to 2021 2) Stakeholders meetings conducted. A draft agreement on information/data sharing within relevant institutions academia and civil society has been prepared. 3) Training has been delayed 4) 2 Climate Change working group meetings held participated by different stakeholders; Inter-directorate coordination meetings conducted during NAP formulation; 4 small-group technical meetings held with key directorates 5) Current policies and legal framework to identify weaknesses and gaps limiting Rio Conventions and gender responsive climate change priorities are reviewed. 6) The workshop Postponed for 2021 7) Formulation of by-laws & operational guidance are ongoing to be completed in the 1st quarter of 2021 8) 20 Public Awareness Raising Workshops on Rio Conventions & Environment in 18 Sucos of 9 municipalities. 9) 0 Printing of Brochures on Rio Conventions 10) 4 articles published in national media & radio on linkages between the global environment and socio-economic issues for publication in popular literature 11) Initial 8 knowledge surveys done in 8 municipalities with total number of respondents around 300. Summary: 1) 80% satisfy with awareness raising activities; 2) 90% got new info on Rio conventions 12) 7 Modules were presented stakeholders and validated and 20 technical staff Training on the use of modules were conducted 13) 7 posts on FB and twitter + several posts on Secretary of State for Environments FB and Environment - Tara bandu activities broadcasted on national TV (RTTL) and on RRTL’s YouTube 14) 2 sets of English training conducted

1) Establishment of Timor-Leste Environment Information System-Web Based Platform under National Directorate of Environmental Education & Information-Secretary of State for Environment 2) Signature of draft agreement on interagency coordination on information management as well as cooperation to mainstream the Rio Conventions management among key Ministries, CSO, Agencies, Academia 3) Best Practices & Guidelines of improved monitoring & compliance are formulated and piloted 4) Training on best practice skills to use data & information is conducted 5) Inter-directorate coordination group is established 6) Inter-directorate coordination meetings are conducted 7) Cooperative agreements are signed 8) inter-ministerial council meetings are convened 9) Training workshop to improve coordination and collaboration are conducted 10) Working Group meetings are convened 11) Agreement on information and data sharing is drafted and approved 12) Learning-by-doing workshop is conducted (based on report produced under 3.1.1) 13) By-laws & operational guidance are formulated 14) 1) National Action Plan-NAP for land degradation finalized, submitted and approved by Council of Ministers; 2) National Adaptation Plan-NAP Framework under Climate Change is approved by Council of Ministries 15) Updated codes, laws & texts are distributed 16) Programs and/or plan for mainstreaming exercise are selected by stakeholder 17) Stakeholder workshops to reconcile mandates among local and regional authorities to allow for the implementation of the selected pilot plan/programme is conducted 18) feasibility study completed and piloted 19) Pilot activities and learning-by-doing trainings are conducted 20) Environmental Road Map is formulated & validated 21) Survey on Rio Conventions understanding is conducted 22) Awareness Raising workshops are conducted 23) Panel Discussion on global environmental issues is conducted through TV & Radio program 24) Training on MEA legislative mainstreaming is conducted 25) Brochures on Rio Conventions are printed & distributed 26) PSAs are produced & broadcasted on national TV & Radio 27) A set of Environmental Awareness Module for Secondary Schools is developed 28) Data & Info on Environment & Rio Conventions are disseminated widely 29) Social Media (Facebook, Instagram, twitter) on Environmental & Rio Conventions are created 30) Three English language courses are conducted
